question.title: Print Alphabets
question.content:
Given two characters, c1 and c2, print all the alphabets starting from c1 to c2, separated by a space, in a single line. Do not print a newline yourself, as it will be handled by the driver code.

Example 1: 

Input:
c1 = 'a'
c2 = 'z'
Output: 
a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z
Explanation:  Printed alphabets from a to z.

Example 2:

Input:
c1 = "h"
c2 = "u"
Output:
h i j k l m n o p q r s t u
Explanation: Printed alphabets from h to u.

Your Task: 
The input characters c1 and c2 are provided as a parameter to the function alphabets. You need to print the alphabets in a single line, separated by space. The new line is provided by the driver code, so don't provide an extra new line.

rephrased.body: Given two characters, `c1` and `c2`, print all the alphabets starting from `c1` to `c2`, separated by a space, on a single line. The newline character will be added by the calling code.

testcases.output: a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z
testcases.explanation: Prints all alphabets from 'a' to 'z' separated by spaces.

testcases.output: h i j k l m n o p q r s t u
testcases.explanation: Prints all alphabets from 'h' to 'u' separated by spaces.

hints: make use of the  keywords ord, chr.
